div1.head: Military Orders for Albert E. Truby, June 2, 1899
div1.p:
1. First Lieutenant Albert E. Truby, Assistant Surgeon,
U. S. Army, is hereby relieved from duty in the Depart-
ment of Havana and is assigned to the U. S. hospital ship
“Terry.”

BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL BROOKE:
W. V. RICHARDS,
Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
C.W. Castle
First Lieutenant, 16th Infantry,
Aide de Camp.

1st- Lieut Albert E. Truby
Asst Surgeon, U.S.A.
Havana
FROM GEN. ALBERT E. TRUBY

SPECIAL ORDERS,}
No. 85.}

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, June 2, 1899.

1. First Lieutenant Albert E. Truby, Assistant Surgeon,
U. S. Army, is hereby relieved from duty in the Depart-
ment of Havana and is assigned to the U. S. hospital ship
“Terry.”

BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL BROOKE:
W. V. RICHARDS,
Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
C.W. Castle
First Lieutenant, 16th Infantry,
Aide de Camp.
FROM GEN. ALBERT E. TRUBY

SPECIAL ORDERS,}
No. 85.}

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, June 2, 1899.

2. Subject to the approval of the Secretary of War, 1st
Lieutenant Albert E. Truby, Assistant Surgeon, U. S. Army,
is appointed Acting Assistant Quartermaster and Acting
Commissary of Subsistence on the U.S. hospital ship
“Terry.” He will report to Captain Alexander N. Stark,
Assistant Surgeon, U. S. Army, on board the “Terry,” for
duty.

BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL BROOKE:
W. V. RICHARDS,
Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
C.W. Castle
First Lieutenant, 16th Infantry,
Aide de Camp.

1st. Lieut Albert E. Truby
Asst Surgeon, U.S.A.

This order
was revoked
Re
FROM GEN. ALBERT E. TRUBY

SPECIAL ORDERS,}
No. 85.}

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, June 2, 1899.

2. Subject to the approval of the Secretary of War, 1st
Lieutenant Albert E. Truby, Assistant Surgeon, U. S. Army,
is appointed Acting Assistant Quartermaster and Acting
Commissary of Subsistence on the U.S. hospital ship
“Terry.” He will report to Captain Alexander N. Stark,
Assistant Surgeon, U. S. Army, on board the “Terry,” for
duty.
